DC95AC424DAF42C7B0DB765BC2353EE8.description: Anchor Standard 11: Relate - Relate artistic ideas and works with societal, cultural, and historical context to deepen understanding.

A30D99699F714B9E8F8C48889B38E2AC.description: Synthesize knowledge of social, cultural, historical, and personal life to create meaningful works of art or design.

20B4AFFF97C24B3EBD4B612DD690F686.description: Access, evaluate, use and manage information to compare similarities and differences in style and technique among schools of art and periods in art history.

76F1DD098B634B72B3BABEAFD9A16FB2.description: Engage appropriately as audience participants in formal and informal settings.

871120871DA245A4A05F931B1595FFA4.description: Construct evaluations for a work of art or collection of art based on different sets of criteria.

75026E6A4E1C4900808D2D3675F6FF66.description: Establish relevant criteria to evaluate a work or collection of art and determine the relevance of criteria used by others.

4168A8B35BA849F0B59ACC70CAFBBA8C.description: Think creatively inspired by diverse cultural beliefs and values, trends and technical innovations that influence personal artistic choices.

F1019567750B42C195ADA390624E0943.description: Anchor Standard 9: Analyze - Apply criteria to evaluate artistic work.

A82B0C10B5374E879F20E14CD365CAA0.description: Construct and justify meaningful interpretation of an artwork or collection of works supported by evidence through describing and analyzing feelings, subject matter, formal characteristics, art-making approaches, contextual information, and key concepts.

03C7C8582BC24808B8A1FB943BE9E3A4.description: Access, evaluate, use, and manage a selected set of criteria to interpret how artists produce critiques that express personal ideas, thoughts and feelings and of others.

96F240674C474CA9974602C78613BF55.description: Hypothesize ways visual imagery influences perceptions or affects human experience.

76235B20C7E04F51958BED158CDE376D.description: Implement innovative responses describing and analyzing the role of design and images in the world.

2716ADD57A674477B93263315AC8E8F1.description: Analyze media used in reflecting on the completed work.

C731B82A7E7146EDABFA8E76FA93BA3E.description: Anchor Standard 7: Perceive - Perceive and analyze artistic work.

1EEF9CF8014D41FBA2D4E8AD281F6483.description: Curate a grouping of objects, artifacts, or art to impact the viewerâ€™s understanding of social, cultural, and/or political experiences.

981A33648565430AA536EA6F96D723BC.description: Communicate clearly cultural values and beliefs, stylistic trends, and technology that have influenced choices to present artwork.

9F6E4FFD9D9841CFA94824B5DE370F35.description: Propose factors that influence artists and inspire artworks.

7FF6CD4A100E4ACB8C6B26DFBD7FD30D.description: Make judgments and decisions by accessing, evaluating and using information from a variety of sources.

31C6B4E56AA444AFA6CD4062BC6D84EB.description: Analyze and evaluate the reasons and ways an exhibition is presented.

6F623A9429284199A4981D2563768508.description: Apply critical thinking and problem solving with use of art vocabulary to describe, analyze and interpret visual qualities perceived and recorded in works of art.

D9FBB0A21A52433F89EC21C3E7E084E9.description: Working from memory, observation and or experiences analyze a work that represents personal ideas, thoughts and feelings.

A7D80EA8650642C59E31C1A34C1052C5.description: Student responsibility for the demonstration of craftsmanship and presentation based on established criteria for a collection, exhibit, event, or portfolio.

F34B115AC637421A99D2966C1065D570.description: Reflect on the values and beliefs of the society in which they were created.

EDADF9A834D64F7D8B2065D791B2CA12.description: Interact effectively with others to determine factors that influenced the creation of art objects that provide social commentary in historical time and places.

98BB8788E1DD4E1CA0B0CDFC6BAE9304.description: Anchor Standard 4: Select - Analyze, interpret, and select artistic work for presentation.

B370C3C351384695BF989D380AF6D516.description: Engage in constructive critique to refine works of art and design while considering relevant, traditional, or contemporary criteria and personal artistic vision.

670F3CEC0F7D412CA66343C8B58C50B5.description: Persistently collaborate to revise and refine work through self-critique and reflection.

67F9A40B31F44DECBFEEEE78DA342769.description: Apply visual organizational strategies to create works of art and design that clearly communicate main/central idea. Manage projects within sketchbook/journal.

41D3E60B51B0431A8D715A9712BB28E4.description: Create works of art or design that demonstrates how visual and material culture defines, shapes, enhances, inhibits, and/or empowers peopleâ€™s lives.

E61140AC80A14B019541106172126F5D.description: Act on creative ideas within the context of a given or chosen art problem.
